alert.note: Alert for Gila Bend; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; West Pinal County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 28 at 4:04PM MST until March 29 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Blowing Dust Advisory, visibility between one quarter mile and one mile in blowing dust. For the Wind Advisory, south winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * WHERE...Gila Bend, West Pinal County and Sonoran Desert National Monument. * WHEN...For the Blowing Dust Advisory, until 8 PM MST this evening. For the Wind Advisory, until midnight MST tonight. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility. Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: Be ready for a sudden drop in visibility. If you encounter blowing dust or blowing sand on the roadway or see it approaching, pull off the road as far as possible and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights all the way off and keep your foot off the brake pedal. Remember, pull aside, stay alive. A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Gila Bend; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; West Pinal County
